pr_title: KOGITO-2476 - Skip Maven invoker plugin tests when using -DskipTests

timeline.message: KOGITO-2476 - Skip Maven invoker plugin tests when using -DskipTests

timeline.bodyText: because it binds to integration-tests phase I would expect this to honor -DskipITs. Does it not? in that case, maybe we should use ${skipITs}
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText:
@evacchi for now this works consistently to avoid that no tests are executed and also supported and how we use failsafe: https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-failsafe-plugin/integration-test-mojo.html#skipTests
From failsafe v3 this will become a problem and then we also need to ensure we update https://github.com/kiegroup/jenkins-pipeline-shared-libraries/blob/master/vars/maven.groovy#L19 so that IT tests are properly skipped from Jenkins build. I will ask @Ginxo about that.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: @evacchi @radtriste @MarianMacik are you ok to merge as is based on my explanation above?
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Yes, until now skipTests skipped all the tests and skipITs skipped just integration tests. It makes sense to me and it's a shame they are going to change it (2 properties will be needed to skip all tests now), but I'm ok with leaving this as it is right now.
replies.author: MarianMacik
